# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 803, 94]]<|/det|>
Find the Maclaurin's series for \(\ln (x + 2) + \ln (x^2 + 5)\) up to and including the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 235, 88]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 95, 653, 123]]<|/det|>
\[x = 1 + \frac{1}{t} \qquad \text{and} \qquad y = t\mathrm{e}^{t}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 147, 144, 166]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 141, 384, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = -\mathrm{e}^{t}(t^{3} + t^{2})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 425, 185, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 425, 336, 460]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 451]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 457, 89]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 100, 692, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\cos 5\theta = 16\cos^{5}\theta -20\cos^{3}\theta +5\cos \theta .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 445, 186, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 444, 455, 463]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 478, 648, 499]]<|/det|>
\[32x^{5} - 40x^{3} + 10x - \sqrt{2} = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 517, 551, 537]]<|/det|>
in the form \(\cos (q\pi)\), where \(q\) is a rational number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 518, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[455, 102, 579, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +3y = \sin x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 147, 660, 166]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 1\) when \(x = 0\). Give your answer in the form \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 92, 776, 357]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 377, 722, 396]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = x \operatorname{sech}^2 x\) and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 409, 144, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 409, 288, 428]]<|/det|>
Show that, at \(M,\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 440, 603, 459]]<|/det|>
\[2x\tanh x - 1 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 623, 490]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 0.7 and 0.8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 470, 920, 490]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 720, 91]]<|/det|>
By considering a suitable set of rectangles, use the diagram to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[326, 104, 745, 148]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 2}^{n}r\mathrm{sech}^{2}r< n\tanh n + \ln \mathrm{sech}n - \tanh 1 - \ln \mathrm{sech}1. \quad [6]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[845, 119, 870, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 845, 96]]<|/det|>
The \(3 \times 3\) matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) has distinct non-zero eigenvalues \(a, \frac{1}{2}, 2\) with corresponding eigenvectors

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 102, 638, 160]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 168, 220, 187]]<|/det|>
respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 198, 144, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 198, 343, 217]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\) in terms of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 200, 918, 217]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 792, 92]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of cosh and sinh in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 101, 631, 121]]<|/det|>
\[2\sinh^{2}A = \cosh 2A - 1. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 101, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 381, 141, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 381, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x^{2}\), for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \frac{2}{3}\). The area of the surface generated when the curve is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis is denoted by \(S\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 670, 452]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(x = \frac{1}{2}\sinh u\) to show that \(S = \frac{1}{32}\pi \Big(\frac{820}{81} - \ln 3\Big)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 431, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 324, 94]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\nu = y^{4}\) and

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[366, 109, 670, 147]]<|/det|>
\[y^{3}\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} + 3y^{2}\left(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\right)^{2} + y^{3}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y^{4} = \mathrm{e}^{-2x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 152, 146, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 152, 240, 171]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 190, 611, 222]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}\nu}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} +\frac{\mathrm{d}\nu}{\mathrm{d}x} +4\nu = 4\mathrm{e}^{-2x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 918, 217]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 673, 102]]<|/det|>
Find \(y\) in terms of \(x\), given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = 1\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = -\frac{3}{8}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 90]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
